desc.p: This Parameter file can be configured by company or an overall default can be defined under the ID 'SYSTEM', if no specific company set-up is required.
15 digit alphanumeric Input
Can be a Valid COMPANY Id or 'SYSTEM'

Specifies the time period for which Reversed / Matured Contracts (with STATUS field as REV / MAT) should be kept in the IAS.CONTRACT.BALANCES file before they are moved to the IAS.CONTRACT.BALANCES.HIST file. Records will be moved only if this field has a proper time period set.
Alphanumeric 5 characters.
Optional Input.
Should be of the format nD/M/Y - where n is a number - a maximum of 4 digits , D - day(s) , M - month(s) , Y - year(s) or it can take the value NEVER.
This can be used to specify the frequency of processing of Hedged Amount Types which updates the HEDGING / HEDGED Amount Type details and effectiveness in IAS.HEDGE.GROUP.
If the value of this field is ONLINE, then this processing is trigerred online.
If a frequency is specified , then the processing happens at EOD - on the date specified.
16 character standard date / frequency format or ONLINE - e.g. M0301 - indicates a Quarterly Frequency falling one the first of the month.
The date given must be greater than today.
Specifies the period of time for which history is to be maintained for Contract Balances.Records in the IAS.CONTRACT.BALANCES.HIST file, exceeding the history period will be cleared at End-of-Day.
Alphanumeric 5 characters.
Should be of the format nD/M/Y - where n is a number - a maximum of 4 digits , D - day(s) , M - month(s) , Y - year(s)
This can be used to specify the frequency of posting of Accounting Entries.
16 character standard date / frequency format - e.g. M0301 - indicates a Quarterly Frequency falling one the first of the month.
The date given must be greater than today.
This field can be used to specify the date and frequency of calculation of the IAS data.
16 character standard date / frequency format - e.g. M0301 - indicates a Quarterly Frequency falling one the first of the month.
The date given must be greater than today.
Description of the IAS.PARAMETER record.
35 Alphanumeric Characters.
This can be used to specify the frequency of posting of Hedged Accounting Entries.
16 character standard date / frequency format - e.g. M0301 - indicates a Quarterly Frequency falling one the first of the month.
The date given must be greater than today.
Last date when the accounting entries are posted will be stored in this field.
This field stores the last date when the IAS is calculated based on the setup in CALCULATION.FREQ.
